page.title: 10Elston Windmill
page.content: The windmill in Elston is called a Tower Mill.It is 15m 24cm high and the walls are 32cm thick.The windmill used to be called the Black Giant of Elston because it was black then, but now it's grey. It's about 150 years old. There are 5 flights of stairs.On the 2nd flight there is a door that leads outside and you can walk around the mill.Mrs Lawrence has been living in the mill for 7 years. They have to have bricks laid in a special way, one row plain and one row header. A long time ago, a boy was watching the men changing the sails,when one dropped on top of him and his head went into the ground. In 1940 the sails were taken down because the German bombers used the sails as a marker because R.A.F Syerston was just behind it.
